name: Herp Derp
author: Jamie Zawinski

sections.description:
This adds a checkbox to your comments page that replaces the text of all of the comments with “Herp Derp”. The setting is persistent for each user, via a cookie.

Select the “Options / Discussion” page to decide whether to Herp by default.

You may find that this makes my blog easier to read. You may find that it makes your blog easier to read.

Inspired by “Herp Derp Youtube Comments” by Tanner Stokes.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the herp-derp directory to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” menu in WordPress
  3. Select the “Options / Discussion” page to decide whether to Herp by default.
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Created

1.1

  • Apparently if a plugin hasn’t been updated in over 2 years, WordPress.org removes it from the public plugin directory under the assumption that it is no longer maintained. That’s my punishment for getting it right the first time, I guess.

    So, I herped the version number. Derp.

1.2

  • Derp.

1.3

  • Don’t keep herping after un-derping. Herp.

1.4

  • Derpier herps.

1.5

  • Made the JS be asyncable. Eliminated some PHP warnings.

1.6

  • Moved the “Herp by default” checkbox to the “Settings / Discussion” page.

1.7

  • Omit unnecessary derpery on feed pages.

short_description: This plugin herps all the derps.
